TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed VariantType extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Indicates the type of a variant object, returned by the `VarType` function.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When you call the `VarType` function, you can use enumeration members in your code in place of the actual values.
The `VariantType` enumeration defines constants used to identify possible `Variant` types. The following table lists the `VariantType` enumeration members.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.VisualBasic.VariantType Array = int32(8192)

Docs.summary: Array. This member is equivalent to the Visual Basic constant `vbArray`.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.VisualBasic.VariantType Boolean = int32(11)

Docs.summary: `Boolean`. (`True` or `False`.) This member is equivalent to the Visual Basic constant `vbBoolean`.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.VisualBasic.VariantType Byte = int32(17)

Docs.summary: `Byte`. (0 through 255.) This member is equivalent to the Visual Basic constant `vbByte`.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.VisualBasic.VariantType Char = int32(18)

Docs.summary: `Char`. (0 through 65535.) This member is equivalent to the Visual Basic constant `vbChar`.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.VisualBasic.VariantType Currency = int32(6)

Docs.summary: Currency. This member is equivalent to the Visual Basic constant `vbCurrency`.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.VisualBasic.VariantType DataObject = int32(13)

Docs.summary: DataObject.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.VisualBasic.VariantType Date = int32(7)

Docs.summary: `Date`. (0:00:00 on January 1, 0001 through 11:59:59 PM on December 31, 9999.) This member is equivalent to the Visual Basic constant `vbDate`.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.VisualBasic.VariantType Decimal = int32(14)

Docs.summary: `Decimal`. (0 through +/-79,228,162,514,264,337,593,543,950,335 with no decimal point; 0 through +/-7.9228162514264337593543950335 with 28 places to the right of the decimal; smallest non-zero number is +/-0.0000000000000000000000000001.) This member is equivalent to the Visual Basic constant `vbDecimal`.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.VisualBasic.VariantType Double = int32(5)

Docs.summary: `Double`. (-1.79769313486231E+308 through -4.94065645841247E-324 for negative values; 4.94065645841247E-324 through 1.79769313486231E+308 for positive values.) This member is equivalent to the Visual Basic constant `vbDouble`.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.VisualBasic.VariantType Empty = int32(0)

Docs.summary: Null reference. This member is equivalent to the Visual Basic constant `vbEmpty`.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.VisualBasic.VariantType Error = int32(10)

Docs.summary: <xref:System.Exception?displayProperty=fullName>

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.VisualBasic.VariantType Integer = int32(3)

Docs.summary: `Integer`. (-2,147,483,648 through 2,147,483,647.) This member is equivalent to the Visual Basic constant `vbInteger`.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.VisualBasic.VariantType Long = int32(20)

Docs.summary: `Long`. (-9,223,372,036,854,775,808 through 9,223,372,036,854,775,807.) This member is equivalent to the Visual Basic constant `vbLong`.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.VisualBasic.VariantType Null = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Null object. This member is equivalent to the Visual Basic constant `vbNull`.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.VisualBasic.VariantType Object = int32(9)

Docs.summary: Any type can be stored in a variable of type `Object`. This member is equivalent to the Visual Basic constant `vbObject`.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.VisualBasic.VariantType Short = int32(2)
.field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.VisualBasic.VariantType Single = int32(4)

Docs.summary: `Single`. (-3.402823E+38 through -1.401298E-45 for negative values; 1.401298E-45 through 3.402823E+38 for positive values.) This member is equivalent to the Visual Basic constant `vbSingle`.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.VisualBasic.VariantType String = int32(8)

Docs.summary: `String`. (0 to approximately 2 billion Unicode characters.) This member is equivalent to the Visual Basic constant `vbString`.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.VisualBasic.VariantType UserDefinedType = int32(36)

Docs.summary: User-defined type. Each member of the structure has a range determined by its data type and independent of the ranges of the other members. This member is equivalent to the Visual Basic constant `vbUserDefinedType`.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.VisualBasic.VariantType Variant = int32(12)

Docs.summary: `Variant`. This member is equivalent to the Visual Basic constant `vbVariant`.
